tool.name: MRMMapper
tool.description: MRMMapper maps measured chromatograms (mzML) and the transitions used (TraML)
tool.command:
@QUOTE_FOO@ @EXT_FOO@ #import re
## Preprocessing mkdir in && ln -s '$in' 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' && mkdir tr && ln -s '$tr' 'tr/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr.ext)' && mkdir out &&
## Main program call
set -o pipefail && @EXECUTABLE@ -write_ctd ./ && python3 '$__tool_directory__/fill_ctd.py' '@EXECUTABLE@.ctd' '$args_json' && @EXECUTABLE@ -ini @EXECUTABLE@.ctd -in 'in/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $in.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($in.ext)' -tr 'tr/${re.sub("[^\w\-_]", "_", $tr.element_identifier)}.$gxy2omsext($tr.ext)' -out 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}'
## Postprocessing && mv 'out/output.${gxy2omsext("mzml")}' '$out'

param.name: in
param.label: Input file containing chromatograms (converted mzXML file)

param.name: map_multiple_assays
param.label: Allow to map multiple assays to chromatograms and duplicate these chromatograms in the output

param.name: error_on_unmapped
param.label: Treat remaining, unmapped chromatograms as an erro

tool.help:
MRMMapper maps measured chromatograms (mzML) and the transitions used (TraML)
For more information, visit http://www.openms.de/documentation/TOPP_MRMMapper.html
